line.en: 'You mustn't go to sleep with your stomach\nexposed just because it's summer, you'll catch a\ncold.'
'Make sure you brush your teeth, and send me a\ntext once... No, three times a day.'
'I've got it, I've got it, okay?'
'Aoi.'
'Yes?'
'Please, take good care of Kotori.'
'Sure, leave it to me.'
I thought I sounded a little arrogant, but I\nanswered as the dorm mother and as Kotori's\nfriend.
'See you, Kotori. If anything happens, call me\nright away.'
Worried about her sister until the end, Hibari\ngot in the car and left.
Today is Monday, the start of the week. It looks\nlike she's going straight to work.
She came here in her own car and apparently her\nworkplace and her house are about an hour away.
'...Hibari stayed for two nights, so I'm\nworn-out.'
'She's a good sister, isn't she?'
'Yes, I realize that. I just want her to know\nwhen to leave me by myself.'
Would Kotori be able to leave her sister alone?
'Okay then, shall we go to school now?'
'Therefore... That is to say, this situation...'
In the sixth class of the day, I felt restless.
When this finishes, school is done for the day.
In other words, it's time for club activities.
Yesterday was Sunday, so clubs take the day off.
I was told that my pilot training would start\ntoday, so I couldn't stop myself from feeling\nlike I was itching to go.
'This is covered in the end of term test, so take\ngood notes.'
The teacher's laidback way of speaking actually\nmakes me feel even more annoyed.
While I stare at the clock on the wall at the\nback of the classroom, I wait for time to pass.
It rang! The bell rang!
'Okay, that's all for today. The things we\nstudied today will be on the end of term test, so\nmake sure to review it later.'
The teacher repeats the contents of the lesson,\nthen the class chairperson gives the order to\n'Stand!', then 'Bow!
'See you, teach!'
'Yeah. Don't run in the hallway.'
As I go into the hallway, Kotori, whose seat is\nnear the doorway, is already outside waiting.
'You took your time.'
'I can't do much about that, my seat's next to\nthe window.'
'Okay, let's go.'
'Ah, hold on. Ageha's not here yet.'
We looked into the classroom, where Ageha was\nsurrounded by several girls, talking to them\nabout something.
'That's why this is...'
It looks like there was something in the lesson\njust now that they didn't understand, and they\nwere asking her about it.
They make a big deal about grades at this school.
If you fail any subjects, it's possible that you\nhave to repeat the year.
It's not like Ageha's grades are anything\nspecial. But, in certain subjects, she's usually\nnear the top of the rankings.
That's why, just before the end of term exams,\nher friends go to her for help.
'Hey, Ageha!'
'Oh, Aoi. Hang on, I'll be finished soon.'
Ageha waves through a gap in the wall of girls\nsurrounding her.
'Hey, Aoi.'
'She said it would take just a little longer.'
'Oh. Well then, let's go on ahead.'
'But she asked us to wait for her.'
